quotes.quote: Transformation is a process, and as life happens there are tons of ups and downs. It's a journey of discovery - there are moments on mountaintops and moments in deep valleys of despair.
The process of transformation consists mostly of decay.
Transformation is an ongoing process that tends to appear ordinary, when, in fact, something extraordinary is taking place.
When we genuinely believe that inner transformation is God's work and not ours, we can put to rest our passion to set others straight.
Yes, your transformation will be hard. Yes, you will feel frightened, messed up and knocked down. Yes, you'll want to stop. Yes, it's the best work you'll ever do.
Nothing gets transformed in your life until your mind is transformed.
Transformation without work and pain, without suffering, without a sense of loss is just an illusion of true change.
Transformation doesn't take place with a vacuum; instead, it occurs when we are indirectly and directly connected to all those around us.
Real transformation requires real honesty. If you want to move forward - get real with yourself.
Transformation is an acquired tasteâ€”not for the faint of heart.
The key to our transformation is simply this: the better we know ourselves the better equipped we will be to make our choices wisely.
Transformation does not start with someone else changing you; transformation is an inner self reworking of what you are now to what you will be.
To transform yourself, you don't need to do big things. Just do small things in big way. Transformation will follow you!
It is our own thoughts that hold the key to miraculous transformation.
Like an actor who transforms into the character that they're playing, you can transform into yourself.
Transformed people transform people.
Transformation does not happen by learning new information. It happens when you change how you view and react to other people, events and things around you.
If you wish to transform, pretend this day until it is so.
Transformation literally means going beyond your form.
You can't have a physical transformation until you have a spiritual transformation.
Transformation doesn't have to be deep, dark and mysterious. If you screw up, fine - laugh at yourself, learn and move on.
During a transformation, it's understandable to be hesitant about moving too fast, especially at the outset.
Transformation isn't a future event, it's a present day activity.
Only love and compassion can bring true and lasting transformation.
Transformation is often more about unlearning then learning.
Transformation can come in the mysterious guise of shape-shifting, or through a simple change of mind.
Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.
Transformation in the world happens when people are healed and start investing in other people.
Know that transformation sometimes begins with a fall. So never curse the fall.
As the caterpillar undergoes transformation within the cocoon before emerging as a butterfly; likewise, life experiences shape character.
